resources:
Module 1 Basics of Digital Communication Theoretical basis for communication Maximum data rate of a channel Transmission impairments Attenuation distortion Delay distortion, Noise Data transmission modes Simplex, Half duplex and full duplex Synchronous and Asynchronous transmission
Module 2 Introduction to Computer Networks Definition of a Computer Network Components of a computer network Classification of networks Network types, Network topologies, networking devices. Network Software and Network Standardization Network Software Protocol hierarchy, Design issues for the layers, Service Primitives Comparison of the OSI Reference Model TCP/IP Reference Mode
Module 3 Physical Layer Switching Techniques Comparison of switching techniques Multiplexing Transmission Medium DLL Design Issues
Module 4 Error Detection and Correction Elementary Data Link protocols for flow control Channel Allocation problem Types of Multiple Access Protocol Local Area Networks - Ethernet (802.3)
Module 5 Network Layer Design issues of Network layer Routing: Principles of Routing Types of routing algorithms Comparison of routing algorithms Protocols at network layer Congestion: Factors of congestion and Congestion control algorithms
Module 6 Transport Layer, Application LayerTransport Layer and Application Layer--> The Transport Service: Transport service primitives Connection management (Handshake), UDP, TCP, TCP Flow control (sliding Window) TCP Congestion Control: Slow Start Application layer: DNS: Name Space, Resource Record and Types of Name Server
Practicals Computer Networks Practicals Practical 1 - Classify the types of cabling used in networking Practical 2 - Survey various networking devices using Packet Tracer Practical 3 - Apply CRC/ Hamming code for error detection and correction Practical 4 - Explain Basic Networking Operations and troubleshooting Practical 5 - Prepare a network and configure it for IP addressing, subnetting, masking Practical 6 - Demonstrate working of Static Routing Protocols Practical 7 - Demonstrate working of Dynamic Routing Protocols Practical 8 - Show implementation of Socket programming using TCP and Remote Login using Telnet/SSH Case Study - \n 1. Analyze Stop and wait protocol/ sliding window (selective repeat / Go back N) in NS2 \n 2. Simulate congestion control (leaky bucket / token bucket) in NS2
